title: When interim dividends, are permitted.
content: 169C. A public company shall be allowed to pay interim dividends only if the following conditions apply: (a) Interim accounts shall be prepared in which the funds available for distribution are shown to be sufficient; (b) the amount to be distributed cannot exceed the amount of profits made since the end of the last financial year, the annual accounts of which have been finalised, increased by the profits which have been transferred from the last financial year and sums drawn from reserves available for this purpose and reduced by the losses of the previous financial years, and sums to be placed in reserve pursuant to the requirements of the law or the articles of association. Sanctions for contravention of sections 169A to169C.
